* Improve comments

* Address review comment
Fix velbus import (#102780)
Change todo move API to reference previous uid (#102795)
Fix fan device actions (#102797)

Move coordinator first refresh in Blink (#102805)

Move coordinator first refresh
Bump HAP-python 4.9.1 (#102811)
Bump pyeconet to 0.1.22 to handle breaking API change (#102820)

Correct logic for picking bluetooth local name (#102823)

* Correct logic for picking bluetooth local name

* make test more robust

---------

Co-authored-by: J. Nick Koston <nick@koston.org>
Use real devices in automation blueprint tests (#102824)

For Martin's review

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,40 @@
+"""Views for Tedee integration, to be used for webhook from Tedee Bridge."""
+
+from http import HTTPStatus
+import logging
+
+from aiohttp import web
+
+from homeassistant.components.http.view import HomeAssistantView
+
+from .coordinator import TedeeApiCoordinator
+
+_LOGGER = logging.getLogger(__name__)
+
+
+class TedeeWebhookView(HomeAssistantView):
+    """Handle Tedee Webhook requests."""
+
+    url = "/api/tedee/webhook"
+    name = "api:tedee:webhook"
+
+    requires_auth = True
comment.body: I'd like to have an opinion here please: Should I leave that endpoint authenticated only (which requires to send a long lived access token unencrypted every time, which grants access to the entire HA instance), or should I make it unauthenticated (it is only used to update status information anyways)?

issue.title: Withings requires reconfiguration again and agai
issue.body:
### The problem

Ever since the updates a couple of weeks ago, after a restart of HA, one or two Withings profiles require reconfiguration. (I have 4 family members linked to the developer account that are using the same devices  such as a scale and a blood pressure monitor). When I reconfigure, I get a dialog with no text in it, and that profile works again for a while. But at the next reboot, usually some other family member needs reconfiguration.

### What version of Home Assistant Core has the issue?

2023.10.5

### What was the last working version of Home Assistant Core?

_No response_

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Integration causing the issue

Withings

### Link to integration documentation on our website

https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/withings/

### Diagnostics information

_No response_

### Example YAML snippet

_No response_

### Anything in the logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
No withings related exceptions or messages in the logs
```


### Additional information

_No response_

issue.title: Disable Negative Energy values
issue.body:
### The problem

So energy Dashboard is showing negative numbers: 

![grafik](https://github.com/home-assistant/core/assets/16965460/ab17cc0d-78b8-4e97-88ba-6e24e1a4f8e3)

As far as i was reading that happened with some integrations, with some devices that resets daily/weekly, after adding a new sensor or in my case when a sensor was longer offline and then comes back a few days later.

What drives me crazy is why there is a negative number at all? there should be a check or similar, i mean we differentiate beetween Grid Consumption, Grid Return, Solar. In this cases its very clear that some cases cant be the case. my pc will never produce energy, so a negative value CANT be the case. 

A solar sensor could be taking and generating energy, but in my case for example i have devices that have two different sensors for this, import and export energy, so here its very clear too. import will never export energy and vise versa.

so just in one specific case it makes sense when a sensor COULD generate negative values, if ist import and export in ONE sensor. this special case should be OPT IN in my opinion.


So to sum up:
 1. A sensor will import OR export. so negative values (or vise versa positive values) will never be the case.
 2. IF a sensor report import and export in ONE sensor, OPT IN for this special behavior

in my case the huge negative value was coming from a sensor that was offline for a longer time

![grafik](https://github.com/home-assistant/core/assets/16965460/6cf77bb5-ed1d-4dcd-8c8b-e90511c300ce)

as you can see there was never any reset, any negative value, any drop or anything else. the device just had communication errors for a few days. Hope to get the DB fixed because this bug as destroyed the year statistic from 2023 at all. 

Some related links:

https://community.home-assistant.io/t/negative-values-in-energy-dashboard-since-last-update/568990
https://community.home-assistant.io/t/solved-negative-values-of-energy/329045
https://community.home-assistant.io/t/energy-dashboard-negative-value/532620
just google and you find tons of frustated users

### What version of Home Assistant Core has the issue?

core-2023.6.2

### What was the last working version of Home Assistant Core?

_No response_

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant Core

### Integration causing the issue

_No response_

### Link to integration documentation on our website

_No response_

### Diagnostics information

not needed

```yaml
not needed
```


### Anything in the logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
not needed
```


### Additional information

not needed

issue.title: Withings requires reconfiguration again and agai
issue.body:
### The problem

Ever since the updates a couple of weeks ago, after a restart of HA, one or two Withings profiles require reconfiguration. (I have 4 family members linked to the developer account that are using the same devices  such as a scale and a blood pressure monitor). When I reconfigure, I get a dialog with no text in it, and that profile works again for a while. But at the next reboot, usually some other family member needs reconfiguration.

### What version of Home Assistant Core has the issue?

2023.10.5

### What was the last working version of Home Assistant Core?

_No response_

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Integration causing the issue

Withings

### Link to integration documentation on our website

https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/withings/

### Diagnostics information

_No response_

### Example YAML snippet

_No response_

### Anything in the logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
No withings related exceptions or messages in the logs
```


### Additional information

_No response_

comment.body:
So let me tell you a bit how Withings tokens work.

If you login on device 1 with user X with credentials Y, you get a token. If you login on device 2 with user X with credentials Y, the first token is revoked.

As far as I know, this is based on the combination user with credentials. So I am now suspecting 2 things:

1. This whole token song and dance has issues with this combination
2. Withings doesn't like the fact that we are requesting 4 tokens at almost the same time at boot.

Do you see any stuff in the logs? Maybe there is some useful Oauth logging at boot with some debug log enabled, I'll have a look if I can find which package to do.

issue.title: Total energy consumption unknown
issue.body:
### The problem

The "DSMR Slimme Meter" integration show the current consumption/production, but the values of total consumption/production say "unknown"

As the documentation mention i selected "5B" for Belgium.

Meter type installed:
Sagecom CS 50001

Meter is connected on USB with the cable from SOS Solutions linked on the document page of the integration.

issue.title: Disable Negative Energy values
issue.body:
### The problem

So energy Dashboard is showing negative numbers: 

![grafik](https://github.com/home-assistant/core/assets/16965460/ab17cc0d-78b8-4e97-88ba-6e24e1a4f8e3)

As far as i was reading that happened with some integrations, with some devices that resets daily/weekly, after adding a new sensor or in my case when a sensor was longer offline and then comes back a few days later.

What drives me crazy is why there is a negative number at all? there should be a check or similar, i mean we differentiate beetween Grid Consumption, Grid Return, Solar. In this cases its very clear that some cases cant be the case. my pc will never produce energy, so a negative value CANT be the case. 

A solar sensor could be taking and generating energy, but in my case for example i have devices that have two different sensors for this, import and export energy, so here its very clear too. import will never export energy and vise versa.

so just in one specific case it makes sense when a sensor COULD generate negative values, if ist import and export in ONE sensor. this special case should be OPT IN in my opinion.


So to sum up:
 1. A sensor will import OR export. so negative values (or vise versa positive values) will never be the case.
 2. IF a sensor report import and export in ONE sensor, OPT IN for this special behavior

in my case the huge negative value was coming from a sensor that was offline for a longer time

![grafik](https://github.com/home-assistant/core/assets/16965460/6cf77bb5-ed1d-4dcd-8c8b-e90511c300ce)

as you can see there was never any reset, any negative value, any drop or anything else. the device just had communication errors for a few days. Hope to get the DB fixed because this bug as destroyed the year statistic from 2023 at all. 

Some related links:

https://community.home-assistant.io/t/negative-values-in-energy-dashboard-since-last-update/568990
https://community.home-assistant.io/t/solved-negative-values-of-energy/329045
https://community.home-assistant.io/t/energy-dashboard-negative-value/532620
just google and you find tons of frustated users

### What version of Home Assistant Core has the issue?

core-2023.6.2

### What was the last working version of Home Assistant Core?

_No response_

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant Core

### Integration causing the issue

_No response_

### Link to integration documentation on our website

_No response_

### Diagnostics information

not needed

### Example YAML snippet

```yaml
not needed
```


### Anything in the logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
not needed
```


### Additional information

not needed

comment.body:
At me the input Data for the energy Dashboard is fine as well... only the calculated Values showing the negative values. The input data comes stable every 5 min, only within the night switch the negative values are partly shown. Thinking further about I come back to a timing issue...  The PV Energy Sensor is a reset value and it seams to me that this information is partly (e.g. if a lot of data needs to be processed in HA)  not considered and so it shows negative values in the Energy Dashboard.

![image](https://github.com/home-assistant/core/assets/101627867/42053610-93ca-4ec0-af68-3fc79a36dbab)
